channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large quantity of fuel being stored on the green, 1st September
item.description:
When walking my dog I noticed there was a large quantity of fuel being stored on the green area on the corner of Brenchley Road. I’m concerned about the fire hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Paul's Wood Hill, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4 Red Barracks Road, 1st September
item.description:
Yet again 4 Red Barracks Road. Ever growing rubbish ALL THE TIME. Why is nothing being done about this? It’s a disgrace. Attracts foxes and the like, leaks out into public footpath and is also a health and safety concern. Greenwich council sort this out already! Absolutely bizarre.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Red Barracks Road, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Red cross painted on roundabout, 1st September
item.description:
This is part of operation raise the flag which is a campaign of intimidation being rolled out across the country under the pretence of 'patriotism'. It is based on racist anti-immigration ideology and should be treated as a hate crime and dealt with urgently. Petts Wood is traditionally a place of safety and refuge and should be maintained as such. The longer this graffiti is left here the more emboldened the culprits will become.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 195, Petts Wood Road, Poverest, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover on Newington Causeway defective, 1st September
item.description:
A manhole cover on the northbound side of Newington Causeway makes a loud clank-clank noise whenever a vehicle drives over it. It is so loud I can hear it from a flat on the courtyard side of Metro Central Heights, and it wakes me up at night. It has been doing it for a few weeks now but I've only just found out how to file this report.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 119, Newington Causeway, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 49 Victoria Road, NW6, 1st September
item.description:
A neighbour reports (FMS-8098562): '[the residents] always leave [their] bins out and never take them inside. It’s one house, so it should not have 6 bins and the bins should not be left out 24/7. Can the council do something about this?'

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Victoria Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
